author: Paul Rankin
method: Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the garlic for one minute. Add the spring onion, chilli, lime zest, prawn peelings and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook for a further minute. Add the coconut milk and chicken stock and simmer for five minutes. Pour the soup through a sieve. Discard the prawn shells but add the rest of the solid ingredients back into the soup. Transfer the soup into a serving bowl and garnish with the coriander leaves to serve.
ingredients: 2 tsp vegetable oil,  ½ clove garlic, chopped,  ½ spring onion, finely chopped,  ¼ red chilli, seeds removed and finely chopped,  ½ lime, zest only,  3 prawns, heads and shells only,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  150ml/¼ pint coconut milk,  300ml/½ pint chicken stock,  small handful coriander leaves
